channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Says Its Forces Likely Shot ‘Unintentionally’ at Slain American Activist
item.description: The Israeli military expressed regret over the killing of Aysenur Eygi at a protest in the occupied West Bank. The top U.S. diplomat said Israel’s con...

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Rescuers Struggle to Reach Victims After Israel Targets Militants in Tent Camp
item.description: Israeli forces said they struck at Hamas militants in an area crowded with civilians. The Gazan Health Ministry said at least 19 people were confirmed...

item.title: SEC and FINRA make tZero second recipient of special crypto license following controversial Prometheum approval
item.description: The approval comes amid calls from the crypto industry for regulatory clarity from the Gensler-led SEC.

item.title: Johnson’s Spending Plan Falters, Facing Resistance From Both Parties
item.description: The speaker’s first effort to avert a government shutdown ran into a buzz saw of opposition from both far-right and mainstream Republicans.

item.title: The search is on for the next Harry Potter—a role which catapulted Daniel Radcliffe to a $110 million fortune
item.description: Millennials, prepare yourselves. A Harry Potter remake is in the works at HBO, and the search is on to find the star who will lead the series.

item.title: U.S., Vowing Sanctions, Accuses Iran of Sending Missiles to Russia

item.title: Singles in Spain Look for Love in the Grocery Store, With Pineapples as Prop
item.description: How the Spanish grocery chain Mercadona got a reputation as an unlikely dating hub, with its upside-down pineapples as props.

item.title: Climate change is coming for the makeup of presidential candidates—and your cosmetics
item.description: From lavender in perfume to cloves in toothpaste, the most common cosmetic ingredients are threatened by a warming planet.

item.title: For Trump, Tariffs Are the Solution to Almost Any Problem

item.title: Ford files patent to collect driver data, including in-vehicle conversations, for in-car ads
item.description: System would “listen for dialogue between passengers.”

item.title: Ukraine Strikes Russia With Large Drone Attack, Killing 1 Person

item.title: Salt Bae’s controversial London restaurant sees revenues fall by £4.3 million as customers cut back on £680 steaks
item.description: Nusr-Et's revenues and profits fell at its swanky Knightsbride restaurant, as group battled cost of living crisis.
